Ameriške poslovne licence za kitajska podjetja

05 Nov 2019, 10:34

Po propadu trgovinskih pogajanj med Kitajsko in ZDA pred slabimi šestimi meseci, so bila številna kitajska podjetja uvrščena na seznam, za katera morajo ameriška dobiti dovoljenje ameriške vlade, če želijo poslovati z njimi. Mnogi so sicer prepričani, da je ta vojna posledica straha, da bi kitajska znanost in tehnološka industrija kmalu prehitela ameriško. Še več, tu naj ne bi šlo zgolj za nerazumevanje med dvema državama na področju trgovine in tehnologij, temveč težnja Amerike po ohranitvi tako imenovane unipolarne ureditve sveta.
Kot vse kaže te trgovinske vojne vsaj kmalu ne bo konec, saj so Američani napovedali izdajo posebnih dovoljenj, ki bodo ameriškim podjetjem omogočala nadaljnje sodelovanje s kitajskimi podjetji. To dovoljenje bo seveda zajemalo zgolj široko dostopne sestavne dele, ki ne ogrožajo nacionalne varnosti Združenih držav Amerike. Po podatkih ameriškega ministrstva za trgovino je doslej zanimanje za posebna dovoljenja izkazalo že več kot 260 ameriških podjetij, kar je po njihovem mnenju bistveno več od pričakovanj. Hkrati pa je ameriško ministrstvo poudarilo, da vsa podjetja ne smejo pričakovati zelene luči.
Čeprav še ni znano, kdaj se bo začelo izdajanje posebnih dovoljenj, se bi to lahko zgodi do konca tega meseca, ko naj bi se končala prva faza trgovinskih pogovorov med ZDA in Kitajsko. Ameriški mediji sicer že namigujejo, da se je Kitajska vendarle strinjala s povečanim uvozom ameriških kmetijskih proizvodov, kar je bil očitno glavni razlog za blokado kitajskih podjetij, in ne zaradi vohunjenja in nacionalne varnosti. Več o tem naj bi bilo znanega kmalu.

US business licenses for Chinese companies

05 Nov 2019, 09:34

Following the collapse of trade negotiations between China and the US just over six months ago, many Chinese companies have been listed as requiring US government approval if they want to do business with them. Many are convinced, however, that this war is due to fears that Chinese science and technology will soon overtake the American one. What is more, it is not merely a misunderstanding between the two countries in the field of trade and technology, but America's tendency to preserve the so-called unipolar order of the world.
This trade war, as it all seems, is not going to end, at least, as Americans have announced the issuance of special permits that will allow US companies to continue to cooperate with Chinese companies. This authorization will, of course, cover only widely available components that do not endanger the national security of the United States of America. According to the U.S. Department of Commerce, more than 260 U.S. companies have shown interest in special permits so far, which they say is significantly higher than expected. At the same time, the US Department of State emphasized that not all companies should expect a green light.
While it is not yet known when the special permits will begin, this could happen by the end of this month, when the first phase of US-China trade talks is expected to end. The US media is already suggesting that China has nevertheless agreed to increased imports of US agricultural products, which was clearly the main reason for the blockade of Chinese companies, not for espionage and national security reasons. More is expected to be known shortly.
